about.heroSubtitle: The apocalyptic survival plan that tastes damn good
about.mainTitle: Artisanal Beers: The Apocalyptic Survival Plan (That Tastes Damn Good)
about.mainQuote: When the apocalypse happens, we can debate it over a glass of beer. Forget our problems for a while. Plan the new world. Or just laugh at how ridiculous it all got. Either way, we'll have something worth raising a glass to.
about.intro: Because here's the thing: artisanal beers are built for thriving, not just surviving.

section1.title: No Unwanted Chemicals – Just Pure, Earth-Grown Goodness
section1.content: Mass-market brews often come loaded with stabilizers, preservatives, and mystery additives to survive endless shipping and shelf life. Craft beers? Mostly water, malt, hops, yeast (and maybe some fun local twists). What you get is honest flavor from real ingredients—no junk you wouldn't want in your body when the world goes sideways (or even on a normal Tuesday). Clean living in a pint.

section2.title: The Fruits of the Earth, Crafted by Real People
section2.content: Artisanal brewing celebrates what the land and human ingenuity can do together. Bold hops, rich malts, seasonal experiments—whether from nearby Aude microbrasseries or masterful Belgian or international artisans. It's a reminder that quality doesn't need a global factory; it thrives in small batches, skilled hands, and imagination. Post-crisis or pre-, that's the life we want: flavorful, natural, and full of character.

section3.title: Saucisson, Bread, and Good Company – The Real Survival Kit
section3.content: Pair that beer with a platter of saucisson, fresh bread, maybe some local cheeses or charcuterie. Simple, hearty, timeless. In our vaulted cellars, you're not just drinking—you're gathering with a loose tribe of people who get it: good beer, good food, good stories. No matter what the outside world throws at us, we adapt, enjoy, and keep the fire (or the tap) going.

about.ctaTitle: Join the Vault Tribe: Survive, Thrive, and Enjoy the Ride
about.ctaText: We're not doomsday preppers. We're just folks who prefer real over processed, flavor over filler, and community over convenience. When things get tough (or stay blissfully normal), you'll find us here—pouring honest brews in 13th-century stone, sharing platters, swapping tales, and toasting to whatever comes next.
about.ctaSubtext: Come for the beer that might outlast the apocalypse. Stay for the vibe that makes every day feel like a win.

history.title: Echoes from the Vaults
history.intro: Deep beneath Narbonne's Bourg quarter, in the cool stone embrace of L'Antre's cellars, history doesn't just linger—it whispers. These vaults, born from the 13th century, have seen trade flourish, secrets buried, and shadows flee. What follows isn't dusty facts, but the kind of local tales that locals swap over a pint: half-legend, half-lure, all intrigue. Pull up a stool. Listen close. The stones might just tell you more.

century13.title: 13th Century: Shadows of the Forge (The Hidden Birth)
century13.p1: Around 1250, the Maison Consulaire du Bourg rises from the limestone—like a fortress for merchants and consuls in the river-hugging chaos of the Bourg. Amid the hammers and mortar, the first whispers stir: hidden passages snaking below, carved for sly reasons. Tunnels to shuttle spices and silks to the Aude's edge (that wild vein now tamed as the Canal de la Robine), or bolt-holes against floods, raids, or the odd heated guild spat.
century13.p2: Then comes the Crusade's chill wind—the Albigensian storm of 1209–1229. Rumor has it a rogue consul, thumbing his nose at the archbishops, tucked a band of Cathar "perfects" into these very vaults. Outcasts with banned scrolls and a firebrand faith, hunkered down with pilfered bread and herbs, plotting their dash to the Pyrenees. The cellars' damp grip? Ideal for ghosts-in-waiting. No proof, mind—just the kind of yarn that makes you eye the shadows funny.

century13_14.title: 13th–14th Centuries: The Buried Gamble (Trade's Wild Heart)
century13_14.p1: As drapes and dyes flood the markets, a canny consul (maybe that same Crusade-defier) plays a long game. He slips a lone gold coin—stamped from the counts of Toulouse's coffers—into the foundations, a "luck charm" to lock in endless coin for his kin and the quarter. Unearth it, the tale teases, and riches rain down... but so does the itch of endless roads, mirroring those footloose traders who chased deals from dawn to dusk.
century13_14.p2: It's treasure-map bait, pure and simple—a nod to the Bourg's gambler's soul, where every bolt of cloth hid a risk. Still, folks wonder: is that glint underfoot the key to fortune... or just another restless curse?

medieval.title: Medieval to Early Modern: The Restless Murmurs (Echoes That Won't Quit)
medieval.p1: Generations grind on, and the grand hall upstairs hums with consul clashes and guild growls. But the stones? They hoard it all. Come a hushed evening—equinox winds rattling the Aude—some swear they catch snatches of old Occitan drifting up: sharp barters over wool, thunderous votes on tariffs, or the low rumble of deals done in the dark. Like the walls hit replay when no one's looking.
medieval.p2: Civic fire never fully snuffed; it simmers, waiting for a gust. Next time you're nursing a brew down here, strain an ear. Might be history's hangover... or just the vaults reminding you who's really in charge.

ages.title: Across the Ages: The Endless Veins (Tunnels to the Edge)
ages.p1: What kicks off as quick-draw river runs balloons into saga stuff: souterrains sprawling wild, threading the Bourg's underbelly like forgotten roots. One thread hooks these cellars (or kin nearby, say the basilique Saint-Paul-Serge) straight to Fontfroide Abbey, 15 klicks into the Corbières' jagged teeth. Fugitives' highway, maybe—Cathars dodging torches, wayward monks dodging vows, or some haughty "roi" (noble pinch-hitter in Revolution rags or religious rifts) vanishing into the night.
ages.p2: The Robine canal's flank? A sneaky on-ramp in the telling, wedding ancient water-ways to midnight mules or desperate drifts. No soul's braved the full haul (or lived to brag), but the pull endures: these depths once wired Narbonne's pulse to the untamed beyond. What's down there now? Spices long rotted... or a path we ain't mapped yet?

history.conclusion: There you have it—the vaults' rough-hewn playlist, scraped from Narbonne's underbelly. Not gospel, just grit that sticks. If the whispers call, they're louder with a glass in hand. What's your take—which tale's got you glancing at the floor?

cta.title: Ready for More Tales?
cta.text: These vaults hold more secrets than we've shared. Come visit L'Antre and hear the stories firsthand over a craft beer.
